jsonData.title: Amazon pushing hard into ocean shipping, making it easier for Chinese goods to get to you
jsonData.subtitle: Quietly and below the radar, Amazon has been ramping up its ocean shipping service, sending close to 4.7 million cartons of consumers goods from China to the United States over the past year, records show.

jsonData.title: Dow plunges 724 points as trade war fears rock Wall Street
jsonData.subtitle: The Dow plummeted 724 points, or 2.9%, underlining mounting concerns among investors about looming tariffs on China. It was the fifth-largest point decline in history and the market's worst day since the extreme turmoil of early February

jsonData.title: Dow dives 350 points, closes at new low for the year after Fed hikes rates
jsonData.subtitle: The Dow gave up a 381 point gain and closed 351 points lower. The major indexes rolled over after Fed Chair Powell said the central bank would continue to shrink its balance sheet, tightening financial conditions.
